Whole Foods’ next niche?

13 Nov 2008

Jackie Huba at the “Church of the Customer” Blog has an interesting discussion going on what Whole Foods might do for it’s next act. Now that your average chain offers organic, how can they compete without getting into a price-war.

She makes a good case for them to focus on special needs diets. it’s a large niche with multiple audiences and they have plenty of avenues to help.

We all know the benefits of a niche focus, but I wonder if WholeFoods specialty isn’t broader–an experience. Everything about the place communicates a passion and respect for food and nourishment. An diet related accessibilty program just seems to be a manifestation of that.

Whole Foods’ next niche?: Church of the Customer Blog.
